document.discussion_title: Bank of Nova Scotia (NYSE:BNS) Receives Average Recommendation of “Hold” from Brokerages
document.topic_text: Tweet Bank of Nova Scotia (NYSE:BNS) has earned a consensus recommendation of “Hold” from the fourteen analysts that are currently covering the firm, Market Beat.com reports . One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have assigned a hold rating and six have given a buy rating to the company. The average 12 month target price among analysts that have updated their coverage on the stock in the last year is $65.78. A number of analysts have recently commented on BNS shares. Desjardins raised Bank of Nova Scotia from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating in a research note on Friday, January 8th. Canaccord Genuity reissued a “buy” rating on shares of Bank of Nova Scotia in a research note on Wednesday, March 2nd. Zacks Investment Research lowered Bank of Nova Scotia from a “hold” rating to a “sell” rating in a research note on Tuesday, February 23rd. Scotiabank reissued an “outperform” rating and set a $66.00 price target (up from $65.00) on shares of Bank of Nova Scotia in a research note on Friday, March 4th. Finally, National Bank Financial reissued a “sector perform” rating and set a $60.00 price target on shares of Bank of Nova Scotia in a research note on Thursday, January 21st. Other institutional investors have modified their holdings of the company. HL Financial Services LLC acquired a new position in shares of Bank of Nova Scotia during the fourth quarter valued at about $727,000. DekaBank Deutsche Girozentrale raised its position in shares of Bank of Nova Scotia by 2.7% in the fourth quarter. DekaBank Deutsche Girozentrale now owns 225,045 shares of the company’s stock valued at $9,346,000 after buying an additional 5,820 shares during the period. Finally, Adams Asset Advisors LLC raised its position in shares of Bank of Nova Scotia by 770.7% in the fourth quarter. Adams Asset Advisors LLC now owns 94,552 shares of the company’s stock valued at $3,823,000 after buying an additional 83,693 shares during the period. Bank of Nova Scotia ( NYSE:BNS ) traded down 0.76% on Monday, hitting $51.16. 442,784 shares of the stock traded hands. The company’s 50 day moving average price is $48.17 and its 200-day moving average price is $43.94. The stock has a market capitalization of $61.55 billion and a P/E ratio of 11.46. Bank of Nova Scotia has a 12-month low of $35.01 and a 12-month high of $56.26. Bank of Nova Scotia (NYSE:BNS) last released its earnings results on Tuesday, March 1st. The company reported $1.43 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $1.42 by $0.01. The business earned $6.37 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $6.32 billion. The business’s revenue was up 8.6% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter in the prior year, the firm earned $1.35 EPS. Analysts predict that Bank of Nova Scotia will post $5.88 EPS for the current year. The business also recently disclosed a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Wednesday, April 27th. Investors of record on Tuesday, April 5th will be paid a $0.5254 dividend. This represents a $2.10 dividend on an annualized basis and a dividend yield of 4.08%. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Friday, April 1st. The Bank of Nova Scotia ( NYSE:BNS ) is a Canada-based diversified financial institution. The Bank offered a range of products and services, including retail, commercial, corporate and investment banking to more than 21 million customers in more than 55 countries around the world.
